image.altText: Anthony Albanese looks on as Tony Burke answers a question in question time

props.synopsis: Home Affairs Minister Tony Burke has defended the country's security agencies amid questions about the granting of a visa to a Palestinian man with alleged links to Hamas figures.

title.children: Government defends visa security checks as Coalition raises concerns over Palestinian man

image.altText: a dishevelled man sits on a cushion outside a mosque with crutches lying in front of him

props.synopsis: About 1.2 million people have been forced from their homes by Israel's bombardment and invasion, the Lebanese government says. They fill the public spaces around Beirut â€“ footpaths, squares, churchyards and schools.

title.children: Beirut's famous waterfront taken over by people fleeing Israeli air strikes

image.altText: Illustration of autonomous self-driving cars.

props.synopsis: A Choice investigation has found most of Australia's popular car brands collect and share "driver data", ranging from braking patterns to video footage and voice recognition information.

title.children: Popular car brands collecting and sharing driver data, including videos, investigation finds

image.altText: Sheila Raymond and family members

props.synopsis: Sheila Thurlow's family is calling for an inquest into her death at a Brisbane hospital after she was injected with 1,000 times the intended dose of morphine.

title.children: Nurse 'Googled' hospital procedure night before woman was given 1,000 times the intended level of morphine

image.altText: Two Melbourne Rebels players after their Super Rugby Pacific loss to the Hurricanes.

props.synopsis: The Melbourne Rebels issue proceedings in the Federal Court against Rugby Australia after they were excluded from next year's Super Rugby Pacific competition.

title.children: 'An appalling lack of judgement': Axed Melbourne Rebels chasing $30 million in damages from Rugby Australia

image.altText: Fatima Payman announcing new party

props.synopsis: Fatima Payman's party will run candidates in both houses, but the senator was unable to identify policies or issues she would focus on.

title.children: Fatima Payman has launched her new party without any policies

image.altText: Anthony Albanese apologises for Tourette slur

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese faces criticism for making an ableist remark in parliament by using Tourette syndrome as an insult, drawing condemnation from both the Greens and the Coalition. Here is a recap of what was said and the facts about Tourette syndrome.

title.children: The PM used a Tourette slur in Parliament. Advocates say it'll have real-life impacts

image.altText: Apartment buildings from a distance.

props.synopsis: Australian Bureau of Statistics data shows approvals for dwellings in Australia has fallen 6.1 per cent, with the biggest drop for approvals in medium and high-density homes. Housing experts say the decline is being caused by rising construction costs and increased risk.

title.children: Dwelling approvals fall in Australia as costs, labour shortages slow approvals for new homes

image.altText: A group of Italian internees in Australia, WWII

props.synopsis: The impulsive fear and punishment of innocent people on the grounds of their appearance or garments or last name is a phenomenon you'd hope had disappeared â€” but it's a mistake we keep making.

title.children: Generations of foreign-born Australians have been punished for their heritage. It's a mistake we keep making

image.altText: Jake Stringer of the Bombers celebrates kicking a goal

props.synopsis: Polarising forward Jake Stringer could be on the move from Essendon to the GWS Giants as day three of the AFL trade period gets underway. Follow for all the latest updates and confirmed deals.

title.children: 'No-one trusts you': Essendon legend's harsh truth to Jake Stringer as Giants eye trade deal

'No one trusts you': Matthew Lloyd's harsh truth to Jake Stringer

image.altText: Satellite image of Hurricane Milton on approach to US

props.synopsis: Hurricane Milton is set to make landfall on Florida's west coast as a powerful and extremely dangerous category five storm.

title.children: Millions in Florida warned homes could become coffins when Hurricane Milton hits

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: New Zealand's central bank has cut interest rates by 0.5 percentage points, citing a weakening economy. The ASX200 is trading in positive territory. See how the day unfolds on the markets blog.

title.children: New Zealand's central bank cuts rates by 0.5 percentage points, ASX in positive territory

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Ampol Aviation workers secure 28% pay increase over the next three years
Will the RBNZ cut rates at its November meeting too?

image.altText: Patricia Karvelas

props.synopsis: ABC News journalist and presenter Patricia Karvelas will take on an expanded role across platforms in 2025, with a key anchoring role on the ABC NEWS Channel in national politics.

title.children: Patricia Karvelas to leave ABC Radio National after 10 years to take on political anchoring role

image.altText: crisafulli and gerber listening to a constituent's question

props.synopsis: David Crisafulli has once again sidestepped questions about whether he would allow a conscience vote on a future KAP bill to repeal abortion laws â€” and why he voted against Labor's decriminalisation bill in 2018.

title.children: LNP leader won't be drawn on future conscience vote over bill to repeal Queensland abortion laws

image.altText: Jacob Hersant, dressed in a white shirt and blue suit, photographed in dappled sunlight outdoors.

props.synopsis: A magistrate says Melbourne man Jacob Hersant will be sentenced to jail after being found guilty of performing a Nazi salute last year. He's the first person found guilty of breaking a new Victorian law that bans the salute.

title.children: Melbourne man found guilty of performing Nazi salute to be jailed

image.altText: Australian actor Hugo Weaving with a white beard smiling with a santa het.

props.synopsis: The trailer features Hugo Weaving, a cameo from rapper Briggs, and a dollop of tomato sauce for sweetness and that extra tang.

title.children: First look at Christmas film How To Make Gravy, based on Paul Kelly's iconic song

image.altText: David McBride looks into the camera in a tight closeup portrait. He is wearing glasses and stands in a dark room.

props.synopsis: David McBride has been in jail since May this year when he was given a nearly six-year sentence for sharing secret military documents with journalists.

title.children: Former military lawyer David McBride granted leave to appeal convictions for sharing secret military documents

image.altText: Jenna Fischer headshot, woman smiling infront of screen

props.synopsis: Jenna Fischer reveals she has been undergoing surgery, chemotherapy and radiation treatment for stage 1 triple-positive breast cancer after a diagnosis last year.

title.children: The Office star Jenna Fischer now 'cancer free' after undergoing surgery and chemotherapy for breast tumour

image.altText: A man with grey hair and glasses sat at a table

props.synopsis: According to court documents, Stephen Wagner is accused of mixing ant poison with his 66-year-old wife's tea for almost two years.

title.children: Sydney businessman accused of attempting to kill wife with ant poison over 21-month period, court documents say

image.altText: Storm cloud rolling into the outskirts of a city

props.synopsis: The first major outbreak of spring thunderstorms is firing up this week across parts of Queensland and New South Wales, bringing with them threats of the destructive supercell storm.

title.children: Supercell storm with destructive winds and hail possible for NSW and Queensland

image.altText: A man looks along the sand covered with dead fish.

props.synopsis: An inlet on Australia's southern coast which turned into a salt lake is being described as a "canary in the coalmine" of what could come with fast-declining rainfall.

title.children: Witnessing 'the death of an estuary' as WA inlet turns into a salt lake

image.altText: Donald Trump stands at a podium, holds his hands outstretched and smiles.

props.synopsis: Australia would be among the countries that would suffer most from what Trump is proposing, after the US and China.

title.children: From mass deportations to huge tariff hikes, here's what Trump's economic program would do to the US and Australia

image.altText: A man and a woman hugging at Brisbane Airport.

props.synopsis: There were emotional scenes at Brisbane Airport this morning as another repatriation flight from Lebanon touched down amid the conflict in the Middle East.

title.children: Emotional scenes as repatriation flight from Lebanon arrives in Brisbane

image.altText: A street sign for Chinamans Lane

props.synopsis: A South Australian council has voted to keep the controversial name of a rural road in Penola. A descendant of one of the first Chinese people in the area says renaming Chinamans Lane would erase a part of local history.

title.children: Council votes unanimously against changing street's 'offensive' name

image.altText: A graphic shows a ballot box with Olympics 2032 written on it.

props.synopsis: There's a predictable pattern an Olympics host city goes through in the lead-up to holding the biggest sporting event on earth. First there's excitement, then there's disillusionment â€” that's arguably where Brisbane is now.

title.children: 'Let's dump the Olympics': Games host cities follow a predictable pattern, starting with excitement. Brisbane is at 'disillusionment'

image.altText: A elderly man, in his 80s, stony-faced and serious, looks directly at the camera. the photo is black and white.

props.synopsis: Gerald Murnane rarely leaves his tiny Victorian town, but bookies have him among the favourites to win this year's Nobel Prize for Literature.

title.children: Author who has never been on a plane could soon be Australia's second Nobel laureate

image.altText: A family of four embrace in outback Australia

props.synopsis: Outback tourism operators are feeling the squeeze as soaring costs and increasing global competition cut into visitor numbers.

title.children: 'Why are we waiting for retirement?': This family sold their home to experience outback Australia

image.altText: A hand holds two Australian passports in Central Park, New York.

props.synopsis: A glitch in Indonesia's e-visa system is inadvertently exposing sensitive traveller information to strangers with at least three Australians able to see passport details of other people.

title.children: 'We are aware of this problem': Australian tourists say private details exposed at Bali Airport

image.altText: ACT Labor Leader Andrew Barr and Canberra Liberals Leader Elizabeth Lee stand on a stage behind podiums.

props.synopsis: Short and sharp, the half hour leaders' debate a week-and-a-half out from the ACT election left both sides content about their performance, and no clear winner or loser.

title.children: Five key takeaways from the ACT election debate between Andrew Barr and Elizabeth Lee

image.altText: Grazer stands in grass in a wooded area

props.synopsis: A female brown bear named Grazer is voted the winner of the popular Fat Bear Week poll for a second year running.Â

title.children: 'Archetypal' mother bear 128 Grazer wins second Fat Bear Week title over rival 32 Chunk

image.altText: A stoat jumping high into the air above the snow

props.synopsis: An image of western toad tadpoles, one of almost 60,000 entries from 117 countries, takes the grand title win in the Wildlife Photographer of the Year competition.

title.children: Demolition ants and a sleepy baby monkey: Here are the winning images from the Wildlife Photographer of the Year
